p: The S protein can be fragmented into two functional subunits, N-terminal S1 subunit and a C-terminal S2 subunit (Fig. 3). Every monomer of trimeric S protein is approximately 180 kDa, and is liable for attachment and membrane fusion. In the structure, N- and C- terminal parts of S1 fold acts as two autonomous domains: N-terminal domain (NTD) and C-terminal domain (CTD) (Fig. 3). Based on the virus, either NTD or CTD can function as the receptor-binding domain (RBD) [ 1]. In adiition, a polybasic (furin) fragmenting site at the junction of the S1 and S2 subunits in the Spike protein of the SARS-CoV-2 was reported, which is absent in the other SARS-like CoVs [ 8]. Data suggests that SARS-CoV-2 is intimately shared with SARS-CoV structural proteins having only 12.8% of difference in S protein and has 83.9% similarity in minimal RBD [ 9].
